questions.text: On your morning walk in the park, you noticed an unconscious man lying on the road. Which of the following options indicates the best next steps?

options.label: A
options.text: Check carotid pulse, start CPR and call for help, defibrillate if no pulse

options.label: B
options.text: Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, Defibrillate if no pulse

options.label: C
options.text: Observe and wait till the ambulance arrives

options.label: D
options.text: Defibrillate, check pulse and do CPR

questions.correct_answer: B. Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, Defibrillate if no pulse
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, Defibrillate if no pulse ALGORITHM FOR CPR

questions.text: Blue pipeline in OT is for which anesthetic gas:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Oxygen In larger hospitals where the consumption of gases is more, it is not possible to change cylinders frequently therefore, oxygen, nitrous oxide and air are supplied through central supply pipelines. Blue color code is given for the pipeline of nitrous oxide.

Highyeild:

The color coding for central supply pipelines is: White- Oxygen Blue- Nitrous oxide Black - Air Choice C- The gases through central supply in India are supplied at a pressure of 60 PSI. Oxygen cylinders are filled at a pressure of 2000PSI while the pressure in nitrous oxide cylinder is 760 PSI.

questions.text: The position of the patient in the Image shown below is :
Match the following dilution of adrenaline and its use (Column – (A) with Column – (B): Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A-2, B-1, C-3 Dose Concentration 1. CPR: 1 mg to be repeated every 3-5 min. IV/IO/ET - 1: 10,000 ET in children- 1: 1,000 2. Anaphylaxis: 0.5-1 mg to be repeated every 3-5 minutes. IM (and S/C) – 1: 1000 IV/IO/ET - 1: 10,000 3. With local anesthetics. 1: 2,00,000 4. For producing local ischemia 1: 1,00,000

Solution:

High-flow nasal cannula This is a high-flow nasal cannula (HFNC) that can deliver very high flow (up to 70 L/mt). through the nasal cannula.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A- HFNC delivers humidified oxygen and it is necessary to deliver humidified oxygen otherwise dry oxygen with such high flows will inhibit ciliary activity. Inhibition of cilia will lead to the retention of secretions leading to atelectasis. Option B- Such high flow creates a PEEP of 4-5 mmHg. Option D- kindly check right option explanation given in wrong option explanation

questions.text: The given set of instruments are used in:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Airway management tray This is the airway management set and it should include: Masks of all sizes (which are not shown in this figure) Airways of all sizes Laryngoscopes with all blade sizes Endotracheal tubes of all sizes Bougies and stylet for difficult intubation Suction catheter Lignocaine spray Laryngeal mask airway Syringe to inflate the cuff of endotracheal tube Adhesive plast for fixation of tube Manual resuscitation bag (AMBU)
